729429f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Franklin Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729429f-a.text:
Richmond Terrace (left, not seen), adjoining the S.E. corner of Franklin Ave., showing a side view of the Ward House, also known as the 'Cement House' since 1837. It later (1898) became the property of Mrs. J. Frank Emmons, and still later (1907) that of Mrs. F. J. Brown. It no longer appears on the 1917 map. The view is eastward from
Franklin Ave.
About 1900.
By O.A. Iugalls.
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P.L. Sperr.
729429f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Franklin Avenue

729473f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Franklin Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729473f-a.text:
562 to 546 Richmond Terrace, south side, between Franklin and York Avenues. The view is eastward.
July 7, 1932
P. L. Spwrr
729473f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Franklin Avenue

729474f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Franklin Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729474f-a.text:
632 Richmond Terrace, south side, adjoining the S.W. corner of Franklin Avenue. This house belonged to the G. Janssen family from 1874 to 1898, to Caroline Acker in 1907, and to Henry A. Tabo, in 1917. Dates refer to maps
upon which owners' names appear.
July 7, 1932
P. I. Sperr
(2)
The same, another view.
July 7, 1932
P. L. Sperr
729474f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Franklin Avenue

729475f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Franklin Avenue, Staten Island, NY
729475f-a.text:
654 Richmpnd Terrace, south side, between Franklin and Lafayette Avenues. The house belonged to Mrs. T. O. Fowler in 1874; to E. S. Clark in 1898; to Robert H. Tompson in 1907,
and to Henry Wlmer in 1917.
July 7, 1932
P. L. S;err
